keyMoments.title: Mao Helps Get Cola
keyMoments.description: Mao works together with Onami to get cola from a nearby stand to refuel Franky's mikoshi during the critical moment of the race.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of Mao, demonstrating her quick thinking and support role in the Pinwheel Eatery team.

keyMoments.title: Mao Punches Brook
keyMoments.description: When Brook inappropriately suggests she wear the magical panties prize, Mao punches him unconscious, causing him to lose his memory again.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Mao's no-nonsense personality and provides the comedic ending to the episode.

reveals.information: Works as a waitress at the Pinwheel Eatery in Grand Jipangu
Based on famous Japanese actress Mao Kobayashi

keyMoments.title: Decides to Help Brook
keyMoments.description: Boss Luffy decides to help Brook after hearing his story from Robin, committing the crew to rescuing him and competing in the mikoshi race.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Boss Luffy's heroic nature mirrors his main timeline counterpart's willingness to help those in need.

keyMoments.title: Rescues Brook with Zoro
keyMoments.description: Boss Luffy and Zoro successfully rescue Brook from Thriller Company's capture.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Boss Luffy's combat ability and loyalty to friends.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Thriller Company
keyMoments.description: After winning the race, Boss Luffy punches Hogback, Perona, and Absalom into the sky for their misdeeds.
keyMoments.significance: Provides the decisive victory over the episode's antagonists.

keyMoments.title: Past with Thriller Company Revealed
keyMoments.description: Robin reveals that Brook was formerly connected to Thriller Company but left due to disagreement with their methods.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Brook's history in this alternate universe and the reason for the conflict.

keyMoments.title: Captured by Thriller Company
keyMoments.description: Brook is captured by Hogback, Perona, and Absalom who want to prevent him from interfering.
keyMoments.significance: Creates the rescue mission that drives the episode's plot.

keyMoments.title: Memory Loss After Inappropriate Suggestion
keyMoments.description: Brook suggests Mao wear the magical panties and gets punched unconscious, losing his memory again.
keyMoments.significance: Continues Brook's recurring memory loss gag from the Boss Luffy Historical arc.

reveals.information: Was formerly connected to Thriller Company in the Boss Luffy universe

keyMoments.title: Builds Thousand Sunny Mikoshi
keyMoments.description: Franky builds a mikoshi modeled after the Thousand Sunny for the race.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Franky's engineering skills in the alternate universe setting.

keyMoments.title: Activates Motorized Wheels
keyMoments.description: Franky activates hidden motorized wheels on the mikoshi, fueling it with cola to match Thriller Company's advantage.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Franky's technological prowess and introduces the cola mechanic.

keyMoments.title: Uses Gaon Cannon
keyMoments.description: Franky uses the Gaon Cannon built into the mikoshi to destroy Thriller Company's mikoshi.
keyMoments.significance: Provides the decisive victory in the race through Franky's signature weapon.

abilities.description: A powerful cannon built into the mikoshi that destroys the enemy shrine.

keyMoments.title: Gets Cola with Mao
keyMoments.description: Onami works with Mao to get cola from a nearby stand to refuel Franky's mikoshi.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Onami's quick thinking and resourcefulness in a critical moment.

keyMoments.title: Denied Prize Money by Igaram
keyMoments.description: Despite winning the race, Igaram refuses to give Onami the prize money due to damage caused.
keyMoments.significance: Creates a bittersweet ending where victory doesn't bring financial reward.
